jwebminer2
Class SearchStringFileParser

java.lang.Object
  jwebminer2.SearchStringFileParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
mckay.utilities.gui.templates.ListInputParser
public class SearchStringFileParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements mckay.utilities.gui.templates.ListInputParser

An implementation of the ListInputParser interface for use by the ListInputPanel class in choosing and parsing of files. Displays a file chooser and parses the selected file(s).

May parse class names from Weka ARFF files or ACE XML Classifications Files, as well as from text files (strings delimited by line breaks). iTunes XML files may also be parsed, and a particular field chosen as the basis for input.

Duplicates are removed from iTunes, ACE XML and text files.

Note that the file type is determined based on its extension, so the file must have a correct extension (.xml, .arff, .arf or .txt).

Method Detail

getStrings

public java.lang.String[] getStrings()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Opens a file browser and load strings from the selected textfile. The parsed file is considered to comprise a list. An array of strings is returned with one entry for each item in the list. This array is not sorted or otherwise processed, aside from the removal of duplicates in iTunes, ACE XML and text files, but no entries may be null. Null is returned if the load is cancelled or if the file does not contain any pertinent information. A descriptive exception is thrown if a problem occurs during paring.

Note that the file type is determined based on its extension, so the file must have a correct extension (.xml, .arff or .txt).

Specified by:
getStrings in interface mckay.utilities.gui.templates.ListInputParser
Returns:
The parsed contents of the file. Null is returned if the parsed file does not return any relevant information or if Cancel is pressed by the user.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative description of any problem that occurs during parsing.

setProgressBar
